A **derivada** representa a taxa de varia√ß√£o de uma fun√ß√£o e √© a base do c√°lculo diferencial.

## Exemplo

$$
f(x) = x^3 - 5x^2 + 2x
$$

```{python}
import sympy as sp
x = sp.symbols('x')

f = x**3 - 5*x**2 + 2*x
df = sp.diff(f, x)
df
```

Gr√°ficos da fun√ß√£o e da derivada:

```{python}
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

x_vals = np.linspace(-1, 5, 200)
f_vals = x_vals**3 - 5*x_vals**2 + 2*x_vals
df_vals = 3*x_vals**2 - 10*x_vals + 2

plt.plot(x_vals, f_vals, label="f(x)", linewidth=2)
plt.plot(x_vals, df_vals, label="f'(x)", linestyle='--')
plt.title("Fun√ß√£o e sua Derivada")
plt.xlabel("x")
plt.ylabel("y")
plt.grid(True)
plt.legend()
plt.show()
```
